p: Our D values obtained with the nCoV data analyses are in the range 1.34–1.85, differing from the Euclidean dimension of 2.0, suggesting a considerable degree of surface complexity. This complexity can be interpreted in terms of the nature of surface contact/binding/infected-site between the viral and host cells, and thus in terms of the patterns of surface interactions [3]. A rough (smooth) site may indicate a potentially stronger (weaker) interaction between protein and the binding molecule [4]. The borders of binary images show irregularity in the image shape; the D values suggest how their complex shapes deviate from classic geometric figures.
